steps: Depositor converts $250,000 fiat to Bitcoin (BTC) via centralized exchange A using fake ID.
BTC sent to crypto mixer's wallet 1 in $5,000 micro-transactions (structuring) to avoid reporting.
Mixer returns anonymized BTC to wallet 2 with address recycling technique to obscure trail.
BTC transferred to decentralized exchange B and swapped to Ethereum (ETH) using private key method.
ETH sent to mixer 2 via wallet 3 with additional $10,000 in dummy transactions to create false flow.
Mixed ETH withdrawn from crypto mixer to wallet 4, converted to fiat on exchange C using offshore account.
Fiat withdrawn to shell company bank account and used to purchase 'virtual goods' for integration.
evasion_techniques: Multi-layer mixing via different blockchain protocols
Virtual goods integration for asset legitimization
